Distributacalcul 0.3.0

Value-at-Risk of the Uniform distribution

Source: R/VaR_unif.R
VaR_unif.Rd

Value-at-Risk of the Uniform distribution with min \(a\) and max \(b\).

VaR_unif(kap, min = 0, max = 1)

Arguments

kap

probability.
min, max

lower and upper limits of the distribution. Must be finite.

Details

The (continuous) uniform distribution with min and max parameters \(a\) and \(b\) respectively has density: $$f(x) = \frac{1}{b - a} \times \bm{1}_{\{x \in [a, b] \}}$$ for \(x \in [a, b]\).

See also

Other Continuous Uniform Distribution: E_unif(), Elim_unif(), Etronq_unif(), Mexcess_unif(), SL_unif(), TVaR_unif(), V_unif(), kthmoment_unif()

Examples


VaR_unif(kap = .99, min = 3, max = 4)
#> [1] 3.99
